page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY-NEWARK
page.content: The castle,one of the most interesting aspects of local history in Newark was built by the Bishop of Lincoln in 1129 The Gate House has changed and now forms part of a large restoration plan Many areas of the castle are now being restored using the skills of craftsmen and stonemasons.Below the Gate House is the Bottle Dungeon and beneath the Great Hall's Oriel window is the Water Gate giving tourists access to the castle from the River Trent.Another interesting Newark Building is the Oss -ington Coffee Palace near the River Trent.It was built in 1882 by Viscount -ess Ossington.Originally built for temperance purposes it has now been restored and it is a licenced restau -rant.Across the River Trent is the Cattle Market which holds weekly sales.The thriving Railway Station connects with Nottingham and Lincoln.
